title: Reporting out of Post-Game Screen
body:
Is there a way to report people out of the Post-Game screen?  I played a game which I didn't do to well on Orianna mid.  The Sona support started being rude and annoying so I muted her and thought nothing of it.  A couple minutes after the game I accepted a friend request as I do all I receive.  The Sona went out of her way to add me and call me a "fucking retard" and to tell me to "uninstall league."

edit: The player immediately removed me after and the conversation was deleted automatically so I have no proof of this.

replies.body:
Your only chance is to submit a support ticket and explain the situation. Riot can most likely pull up the offending chat logs.

######Edited for typos.

Support tickets can be submitted here:

http://support.riotgames.com/

I believe Riot has access to private chat logs, either through their server or on your computer. Hopefully they can help you with it.

You never add someone who did flame you ingame, they will never have something good to say.

You can try to submit a support ticket but if I remember correctly Riot mentioned somewhere that they don't ban people for personal messages since they don't want to restrict the way people personally communicate with each other.
